Jacob Garby

Hello, welcome to my website! I'm Jacob, and at the moment I'm a PhD student at Chalmers University, Gothenburg, doing computer things. In particular, I'm trying to speed up various algorithms (SGD, graph algorithms, etc.) with custom runtime systems! …

  • Blog
  • Contact Me
  • Projects
  • My Research

… Aside from that, I also like low level software development (like operating systems and microcontroller programming), graphics programming (visualisations, games, etc.), and network protocols and distributed systems.

I also really enjoy going to hackathons (events where you spend 24 hours, with a team, to make whatever project you want). According to Devpost, I've been to nine of these (but it's missing at least one). Of all these, my friends and I have won first place three times! They're very fun, you should definitely go if you have the chance.

But anyway, there are also some things that I do which don't even involve computers at all! I play guitar, enjoy mechanical keyboards (okay, that one is computer related), really like tea, and enjoy cooking and electronics.

You can resize this panel at its bottom-right corner!

Contact Me!

You’re welcome to contact me about more or less anything (unless you’re a robot). However, it’s not uncommon that I’ll see an email, plan on replying to it later, and then entirely forget about it – if that happens, feel free to try again :)
